text.p: Diagnostic Health Services Inc said Thursday it received net proceeds of $8.67 million from the exercise of warrants by its shareholders under a redemption program.
It said warrantholders exercised abut 98 percent of the company's 1.375 million warrants to purchase common shares at $6.25 a share.
It called for the redemption of the warrants on February 17 and the shareholders' exercise yielded about $8.4 million, it said.
Aditionally, it said that 40,000 privately held common stock purchase warrants were exercised at the same price, raising about $250,000.

Proceeds from the warrant exercise will be used to reduce debt, finance a portion of the purchase of Diagnostic Imaging Services Inc and for other possible acquisitions and general corporate purposes, said Max Batzer, chairman and chief executive officer of the company.
Batzer said Diagnostic Health looks forward to the cessation of arbitrage activity involving the company's common stock, which took place during the redemption period.
